thread.title: Trad gets transport portfolio in Queensland Cabinet reshuffle
thread.title_full: Trad gets transport portfolio in Queensland Cabinet reshuffle

title: Trad gets transport portfolio in Queensland Cabinet reshuffle
text:
Queensland Cabinet reshuffle: Jackie Trad named as Transport Minister Updated February 10, 2017 10:54:38 Map: Brisbane 4000 
Queensland Deputy Premier Jackie Trad has been named Transport Minister, in a Cabinet reshuffle sparked by the resignation of Stirling Hinchliffe. 
Premier Annastacia Palaszczuk has tasked Ms Trad with turning around the embattled Queensland Rail, which has been plagued by a driver shortage and service cancellations in the past few months. 
"The only person who can get to the bottom of it, ensure those recommendations are implemented, is the Deputy Premier," Ms Palaszczuk said. 
"She has determination, she has an aptitude for policy work to get down into the detail , and I know that she can fix this." 
The ABC understands new Minister Mark Furner will be allocated the local government and indigenous portfolios. 
Education Minister Kate Jones has again had the Commonwealth Games portfolio added to her responsibilities, also taking over from Mr Hinchliffe. 
Ms Palaszczuk said Ms Jones had performed will as Education and Tourism Minister. 
"There has been extensive lobbying for the return of Kate Jones to this portfolio," she said. 
"I know that the tourism sector has said that she is the best Tourism Minister that they have seen in this state, 
"From an education perspective, Kate Jones is not just the best Education Minister that the state has ever seen, she is the best Education Minister that Australia has ever seen."
